ItemCatalogData.uint8 bIsCreativeModeOnly: Does this item only show up in the catalog in creative mode?
ItemCatalogData.uint8 bCreativeSpawnPackaged: Does this item spawn as a package when spawned in from the catalog in creative mode?
ItemCatalogData.int32 UnlockCost: How many bytes are needed to unlock this entry in the catalog?
ItemCatalogData.uint8 bIsBaseItem: Is this item the base of its catalog row?
ItemCatalogData.UItemCatalogCategoryDefinition* Category: If this item is the base of the catalog row, this is the tab of the catalog that the entry is in; otherwise, this is None
ItemCatalogData.int32 CategorySequenceNumber: Y value (0 = first row of the tab, 1 = second row of the tab, etc.)
ItemCatalogData.TSubclassOf<UItemType> BaseItemType: A reference to the item that is the base of the catalog row (If this is the base item, leave this as None)
ItemCatalogData.EItemVariantType VariantType: Is this entry to the left or the right of the base item in the catalog row? (If this is the base item, leave this as Left)
ItemCatalogData.int32 VariationSequenceNumber: |X| (0 = the base entry, 1 = directly before or after the base entry, etc.)
ItemCatalogData.UStaticMesh* CatalogMesh: The model that shows in the catalog to represent this item

ItemComponent.Capacity: If this is a canister, how much can it hold?

PhysicalItem.PrinterHeight: The height of the printer, overrides the default determined height value if defined
PhysicalItem.ToolMoveTier: The tier of the object. 1 = T1, 2 = T2, etc. Controls fallback slot size, default package size, as well as walking speed
PhysicalItem.IsMovable: Can this item be picked up and moved around with the cursor?
PhysicalItem.SlotQueryAllowBodyPlacement: Can this item be directly attached to the body of an object (like packagers and dynamite do)?

ItemType.uint8 IsVolatile: Whether or not the item contributes to an explosion, like Hydrazine does
ItemType.uint8 bCanBeScrapped: Can this be put into a shredder?
ItemType.uint8 bIsUnrepackageable: Can this item not be packaged with a packager?
ItemType.TArray<TSubclassOf<UItemType>> Container: What items can go into this container?
ItemType.TSubclassOf<AActor> PickupActor: The Actor (PhysicalItem) that this ItemType represents

AstroPlanet.FVector GetNorthVector(): Returns a vector that points North

PowerComponent.float NetPowerOutput: If this number is positive, it is the U/s that this machine will output. If this number is negative, it is the U/s that this machine will draw.
PowerComponent.uint8 SelfDischargeOnly: Unsure, only rovers seem to use this field
PowerComponent.uint8 IsIntegratedBattery: Is this battery built into the chassis of a machine?
PowerComponent.uint8 QueryPower: Does this machine need power to work?
PowerComponent.float StorageCapacity: The amount of energy that this battery can hold in units
PowerComponent.float DischargeRate: The number of U/s that this battery can discharge
PowerComponent.float ChargeRate: The number of U/s that this battery can charge

AstroPlayerState.FString BackendPlayerId: The PlayFab ID of a player. Seemingly only accessible on dedicated servers.
